creator: Gazette Printing Company
extent: 1 map : 2 col. ; 38.7 x 69.2 cm. on sheet 41.6 x 71 cm. folded to 21 x 11.5 cm.
notes: Shows boundary of the Province, the two Mennonite Settlement areas, surveyed townships and the railways. Kenora is still Rat Portage. Extends only to Fort Ellice in present-day Manitoba. "N.B. Additional Townships are being Surveyed every year." Title of pamphlet: "Manitoba and the North-West: the great wheat fields, and stock-raising districts, of Canada: Facts and information for settlers, with a map of the country." Also contains publication information.
subject: Railroads--Manitoba
Railroads--Saskatchewan
Manitoba
Saskatchewan
title: Canada: Manitoba and the North West, general plan of the country shewing railway lines constructing through the wheat fields and grazing lands
